results.title: Steps of the ballet
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Alexander Shaw and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Deals with the creation of a ballet. The basic positions, movements and steps are demonstrated. The dancers’ steps are explained by Robert Helpmann, famous ballet dancer and choreographer. The film ends with the presentation of a new ballet to show how the arts of dancing, music and painting join together in its creation. Featured dancers include Alexander Grant (New Zealand), Elaine Fifield, Gordon Hamilton (Australia), Gerd Larsen, Peter Wright (United Kingdom), with Joan Harris (United Kingdom) as Ballet Mistress. Narrated by Robert Helpmann.

results.title: Stepping out: the birth of a theatre of the mentally handicapped
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan and Binnaburra Film Company
results.brief_description: Sensitively explores the lives of a unique theatre group of intellectually handicapped people preparing for their first public performance at the Sydney Opera House. Two members of the group, Chris 31 and Romayne 21, who have lived in the institution since early childhood express their attitudes to each other, their lives and hopes for the future. This film was chosen as the film for the International Year of the Disabled by the United Nations. Music: Keith Jarrett Camera: Dean Semler.

results.title: Stephen Banner: supervisor
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson, Commonwealth Public Service Board and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: At all levels, work and efficiency depends upon supervision. The supervisors’ efficiency always determines the efficiency of his section. Shows how a supervisor, although competent in their own field, may lack the qualities of a good supervisor. Emphasises that a supervisor should ask the following questions: WHAT does my section do?, WHY does my section do this work? and HOW does my section perform this work?

results.title: Stephane Grappelli in Concert
results.brief_description: Filmed at the Dallas Brookes Hall, Melbourne, on 26th August 1975. At 75 years of age and with a career spanning more than 60 years, Stephane Grappelli is considered the world’s greatest living jazz violinist. This concert features Grappelli with the Diz Disley Trio.

results.title: Stepfamily Dynamics
results.creator_credit: Shaun Gibbons, Velissa Cheers, Paul Van Dacon, Justine Anderson, Jane Keehn and Robert Ketton
results.brief_description: Five vignettes are shown and each one illustrates a different situation in stepfamily life. The purpose of the vignettes is to increase the awareness of the complex interactions in the contemporary stepfamily and this video is a useful educational or counselling aid for stepfamily couples

results.title: Step right up!
results.creator_credit: Mike Lloyd Ross, Ray Jewell and Film Communications
results.brief_description: Illustrates the possible hazards and improper procedures when using ladders. Shows the proper use of stepladders, straight ladders, and extension ladders. Also focuses on inspection, maintenance, carrying, ladder stances, erecting and securing, climbing and descending. Camera: Peter Good.

results.title: Step by step
results.creator_credit: Sam Kluk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sam Kluk loved his beautiful town of Kuranda in Northern Queensland. Unfortunately, there was another side to the quiet town and Kluk was determined to take every opportunity to escape it.

results.title: Step by step
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Aid given to cerebral palsied children. Private individuals seeing the need established Spastic centres. Basic school syllabuses are slightly modified to suit the physical and mental ability of each child. Special equipment compensates for handicaps. Difficulty in mixing with others can be overcome with specialised aid in the play centres. Teaching them to walk, balance and control movements, and teaching the deaf to speak require highly specialised therapy.

results.title: Step by step
results.creator_credit: Faith Hubley, Pyramid Films and Hubley Studios
results.brief_description: Created in honour of the International Year of the Child, film director Faith Hubley interprets the world of childhood - as it was, as it is now, and as it might be. Distinctive animated children of every race and nationality appear on the screen, accompanied by the voices of children chanting in Spanish and French, with key phrases spoken in English. Viewers see the bleakness of childhood throughout history, the full range of childhood experiences - from poverty to plenty, work to leisure, and the possibilities of the future when the basic rights of children are recognised by us all. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
